byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Boston, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.
byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

abstract: Many of victims of Boston Marathon bombing of 2013 react with ambivalence to jury sentencing Dzohkhar Tsarnaev to death; some praise decision and say Tsarnaev deserves death sentence.
lead_paragraph: Victims and emergency medical workers reacted online and off to the jury decision that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev should get the death penalty for the 2013 attack.

headline.main: Victims Find Solace and Sorrow in Boston Verdict and Are Ready to Move On
headline.print_headline: Victims Find Solace and Sorrow in Boston Verdict and Are Ready to Move On

snippet: Victims and emergency medical workers reacted online and off to the jury decision that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev should get the death penalty for the 2013 attack.
